results.title: Holy She*p
results.creator_credit: Magnus Kravik, Katerina Pantela and Arts University Bournemouth
results.brief_description:
Pursued by a nun with a shearing blade, a sheep tries frantically to escape. Does the cruise ship visiting his island hold a hope of sybaritic freedom? Perhaps, but not in quite the way our protagonist dreams.
Story and animation: Parina Mehta, Katerina Pantela, Magnus Kravik
Layout, background and design: Heather Vogel, Katerina Pantela
Assistant animators: Mengly Li, Dominic Elsey
Editors: Carl Reader, Thorbjorn Munter
Music and sound design: Daniel Weismayr

results.title: Z
results.creator_credit: Alan Warburton, Lupus Films, Animate Projects and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Is hindsight 20:20? Does history reveal or obscure the truth? Can we predict the future? Will history repeat itself? Are we in control?

results.title: Mozart's House
results.creator_credit: Jack Patterson, Clean Film and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Made during Moscow’s biggest ever heat wave when the smog was thick and Red Square was actually red. The song was sung very slowly, the footage was then sped up to reflect the high energy vocals and the synths lines that sound almost randomised.
results.description: Made during Moscow’s biggest ever heat wave when the smog was thick and Red Square was actually red. The song was sung very slowly, the footage was then sped up to reflect the high energy vocals and the synths lines that sound almost randomised.

results.title: The Estate
results.creator_credit: Mike Carr, Caswell Coggins, Balletboyz, Crossfire and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A short dance piece set in an English housing estate. The choreography is loosely based on the idea of vultures circling a dying animal, feeling their excitement and anticipation as they gather to feed, waiting for the moment to strike.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Carr, Caswell Coggins, Balletboyz, Crossfire and Channel 4

results.title: Robots of Brixton
results.creator_credit: Kibwe Tavares, Factory Fifteen and Channel 4
results.brief_description: Brixton has degenerated into a disregarded area inhabited by London’s new robot workforce. When the Police invade the one space the robots call their own, the strained relationship between the two sides explodes into an outbreak of violence echoing that of 1981.
results.description: Brixton has degenerated into a disregarded area inhabited by London’s new robot workforce. When the Police invade the one space the robots call their own, the strained relationship between the two sides explodes into an outbreak of violence echoing that of 1981.

results.title: My City
results.creator_credit: Robert Ryan, Deuce Films and Channel 4
results.brief_description: The film highlights a part of London that is often forgotten; the gap between the rich and poor, street crime, the rich melting pot of cultures, rundown urban spaces and how expensive it is to really enjoy our capital…
results.description: The film highlights a part of London that is often forgotten; the gap between the rich and poor, street crime, the rich melting pot of cultures, rundown urban spaces and how expensive it is to really enjoy our capital…

results.title: Acts of Kindness
results.creator_credit: Pinky Ghundale, Michael Landy, Film London and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A celebration of everyday acts of kindness that happen on London Underground every day of the year. The film originated from ‘Acts of Kindness’, a project by Michael Landy for London Underground, commissioned by Art on the Underground, London Underground Limited, 2011-12.
